name: linearity
content:
linearity noun [U]
(ORDER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of involving a series of events or thoughts in which one follows another one directly: Linearity is rare in true autobiographies. We don't live in a straight line. The conventional linearity of the narrative is constantly subverted.
More examplesFewer examplesFilm sequences that once were run together by a studio demanding linearity have now been fractured and intercut in accordance with Welles' intentions.I'd rather let an offensive post stand and see an apology than have it deleted. I hate having the linearity of the discussion destroyed.She plays with sentence format and punctuation as fearlessly as she disregards linearity of story line. His approach to narrative replaces the rigid linearity of the three-act model with complex, impressionistic forms.

linearity noun [U]
(LINES)
the fact of consisting of straight lines: It is the beautiful linearity of the compositions that predominates in this exhibition.
More examplesFewer examplesThe strict linearity of the prints is at times offset by curves.In her art, the harsh linearity and semi-abstraction of cubism are apparent.
